alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 12:24AM EST until January 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Greenville County in Upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas will continue along the Reedy River basin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1221 AM EST, High water conditions from recent heavy rainfall continues along the Reedy River basin in Greenville County. Minor flooding will be most common along the Reedy River at Highway 418, where Marler Road near Dunklin Bridge Road will remain flooded. Flooding will also continue into the early morning hours at the Reedy River at Hudson Street. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Mauldin, Berea, Donaldson Center, Cherrydale Point and Fork Shoals. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
